org.sindice.siren.index

Interface DocsAndNodesIterator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConstrainedNodesEnum, DocsNodesAndPositionsEnum, IntervalConstrainedNodesEnum, LevelConstrainedNodesEnum, MappingMultiDocsNodesAndPositionsEnum, MultiDocsNodesAndPositionsEnum, SingleIntervalConstrainedNodesEnum

    public interface DocsAndNodesIterator
    Interface that defines methods to iterate over a set of increasing doc identifiers and node labels.

    This class iterates on doc ids and node labels. The sentinel value NO_MORE_DOC (which is set to 2147483647) is used to indicate the end of the document stream. The sentinel value NO_MORE_NOD (which is set to [2147483647]) is used to indicate the end of a node stream.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int NO_MORE_DOC
      When returned by doc() it means there are no more docs in the iterator.
      static org.apache.lucene.util.IntsRef NO_MORE_NOD
      When returned by node() it means there are no more nodes in the iterator.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int doc()
      Returns the following: -1 or NO_MORE_DOC if nextDocument() or skipTo(int) were not called yet.
      boolean nextDocument()
      Advances to the next document in the set.
      boolean nextNode()
      Move to the next node path in the current document.
      org.apache.lucene.util.IntsRef node()
      Returns the following: -1 or NO_MORE_NOD if nextNode() or #skipTo(int, int[]) were not called yet.
      boolean skipTo(int target)
      Skip to the first document beyond (see NOTE below) the current whose number is greater than or equal to target.

    • Field Detail

      • NO_MORE_DOC

        static final int NO_MORE_DOC
        When returned by doc() it means there are no more docs in the iterator.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • NO_MORE_NOD

        static final org.apache.lucene.util.IntsRef NO_MORE_NOD
        When returned by node() it means there are no more nodes in the iterator.

    • Method Detail

      • nextDocument

        boolean nextDocument()
                     throws IOException
        Advances to the next document in the set.
        Returns:
        false if there is no more docs in the set.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • nextNode

        boolean nextNode()
                 throws IOException
        Move to the next node path in the current document.

        Should not be called until nextDocument() or skipTo(int) are called for the first time.

        Returns:
        false if there is no more node for the current document or if nextDocument() or skipTo(int) were not called yet.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • skipTo

        boolean skipTo(int target)
               throws IOException
        Skip to the first document beyond (see NOTE below) the current whose number is greater than or equal to target. Returns false if there are no more docs in the set.

        Behaves as if written: 

         boolean skipTo(int target) {
   while (nextDocument()) {
     if (target ≤ doc())
       return true;
   }
   return false;
 }
        Some implementations are considerably more efficient than that.

        NOTE: when target ≤ current implementations must not advance beyond their current doc().

        Throws:
        IOException

      • doc

        int doc()
        Returns the following:
        • -1 or NO_MORE_DOC if nextDocument() or skipTo(int) were not called yet.
        • NO_MORE_DOC if the iterator has exhausted.
        • Otherwise it should return the doc ID it is currently on.

      • node

        org.apache.lucene.util.IntsRef node()
        Returns the following:
        • -1 or NO_MORE_NOD if nextNode() or #skipTo(int, int[]) were not called yet.
        • NO_MORE_NOD if the iterator has exhausted.
        • Otherwise it should return the node it is currently on.
